content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and easy one

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice for a fast one, and doable in reverse as well.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: lgtm. Doable in reverse
If someone could please help me format the input part in a better way, please let me know.

You may refer to the example here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Based on the guidelines, I would suggest to rewrite Input section as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of sequences
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A string [[sequence]] for a DNA strand

And Output section as follows:
<<[[N]] lines>>: The GC percentage of each string rounded to one decimal place

Other comments:

Goal section
* Please change "decimal" to "decimal place".

Output section
* As shown in the suggestion above, please change "decimal" to "decimal place".

Constraints section
* Please delete "Number of sequences".

* Please change "1 <" to "1 ≤" or "0 <".

* Please change "Sequence length" to "1 < length of [[sequence]]".

Cases
* Validator 4 and "long sequence" Test are the same. Please revise either/both of them to make them different.

* "AAAA" appears in both Test 1 and Test 3. Suggest to change them so that they are different (e.g. vary the lengths).

Thanks.
Thanks, I think the amount of cases are sufficient for reverse (:
For a minute I completely forgot what reverse meant and thought it meant "reverse engineer the input from the output" and realized that would not be doable at all :D

Thanks for the feedback. I have made the changes you suggested.

I still have some questions, could you help me with those?

Do you know whether "Here, you have to calculate the..." falls under "addressing the reader directly"? 

Is there a way to get multiple examples to be shown? I felt 'forced' to put multiple 'cases' in the first Test so a reader can have a quicker overall idea of the objective.

Thank you for your reply and making the changes.

Regarding your questions:
* I think your current text is fine as it is. Don't worry about it if you aren't addressing the reader like what the example does.

* The only other way to show multiple examples all at the same place is to put them in Goal section.

Other comments:

Constraints section
* Please change "1 0" to "1 ≤".

Cases
* Please avoid having the same input within the same case or across different cases. For example, there are 2 "AT" in Validator 1 and 2 "AC" and 3 "AG" in Validator 2. Please remove the duplicates from all tests and validators.

Thanks.
